column4: Is there a channel specifically for partitioning trouble?  I'm having all sorts of troubles.
I'm getting a "The superblock could not be read or does not describe a correct ext2 filesystem. " error from fsck.
How do I fix the partition so I can boot my computer again?  Any ideas?
I'm not sure the magic options to make it restore from another block (or if that's just a ufs thing)
Well, I need to restore it somehow.
I can mount the partitions, but I can't boot for some reason.
is the partition marked as bootable?
I don't know.  Gparted hangs every time I try to run it.
Is there another way to find out beside gparted?
no, but I'll give that a shot.  (I didn't know about it)
No, it doesn't appear to have a boot flag, for one thing.
Alright, I've set the boot flag, but that won't fix the superblock problem will it?
I doubt it, but if there were a superblock error, I don't think it would let you mount
hmm, maybe it's a false alarm, or a wrong command or something.
